title: Why is Procol Harum’s “A Whiter Shade of Pale” considered to be a touchstone in the development of progressive rock? - Quora

response.answer_text: The haunting somber organ, measured tempo, declamatory vocals, impressionistic yet inscrutable lyrics…the fact that this was a hit single showed how much the game had changed. Procol Harum were perhaps the first rock band named after a cat. They were a left of centre offering for a prog band.

I think it’s because they used keyboards to sample a piece by Bach in that song. I don’t believe that had been done yet at the time. They were definitely not a traditional rock band, and even though I had never taken the time to label them, I think progressive does a good job. Conquistador was really cool too. Very unlike what was going on back then!
